gw.cc.metric.entity

Interface PolicyTypeMetricLimits


  • public interface PolicyTypeMetricLimits
    PolicyTypeMetricLimits Lists all the claim and exposure metric limits for a particular policy type

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static PolicyTypeMetricLimitsCache cache
      Cache for looking up PolicyTypeMetricLimits objects by policy type

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PolicyTypeMetricLimits ensureDefaultLimitsCreated()
      Ensures that default limits (limits with no tier) are created for all the different metric types.
      java.util.List<ClaimMetricLimit> getClaimLimitsAsOfGeneration(int generation)
      Return the claim limits as they were at a particular generation count.

    • Field Detail

      • cache

        static final PolicyTypeMetricLimitsCache cache
        Cache for looking up PolicyTypeMetricLimits objects by policy type

    • Method Detail

      • ensureDefaultLimitsCreated

        PolicyTypeMetricLimits ensureDefaultLimitsCreated()
        Ensures that default limits (limits with no tier) are created for all the different metric types. After this method has been called, calling getClaimMetricLimits or getExposureMetricLimits is guaranteed to return an array that contains default limits for all the currently configured metric types.
        Returns:
        the current PolicyTypeMetricLimits object

      • getClaimLimitsAsOfGeneration

        java.util.List<ClaimMetricLimit> getClaimLimitsAsOfGeneration(int generation)
        Return the claim limits as they were at a particular generation count. The result may contain retired limits (because limits are retired when they are no longer active).

        When limits are modified we do a "copy on write" - we retire the current limit, preserving its original values and marking it as retired with the current generation number. Then we create a new limit to take its place, marking it as created with the current generation number. This allows us to find the limits that were in force at any particular generation number by looking for limits where: CreatedGeneration <= generation and (RetiredGeneration is null or RetiredGeneration > generation)

        If given a generation number that never existed or does not yet exist, this method will always return an empty list.

        This method assumes that all the limits are up to date and in the database; it does not look in the current bundle for any pending changes. The limits it returns are readonly.

        Parameters:
        generation - the generation as of which we want to find the limits
        Returns:
        a possibly empty list of claim metric limits that were in force at the given generation number.

      • getExposureLimitsAsOfGeneration

        java.util.List<ExposureMetricLimit> getExposureLimitsAsOfGeneration(int generation)
        Return the exposure limits as they were at a particular generation count. The result may contain retired limits (because limits are retired when they are no longer active).

        When limits are modified we do a "copy on write" - we retire the current limit, preserving its original values and marking it as retired with the current generation number. Then we create a new limit to take its place, marking it as created with the current generation number. This allows us to find the limits that were in force at any particular generation number by looking for limits where: CreatedGeneration <= generation and (RetiredGeneration is null or RetiredGeneration > generation)

        If given a generation number that never existed or does not yet exist, this method will always return an empty list.

        This method assumes that all the limits are up to date and in the database; it does not look in the current bundle for any pending changes. The limits it returns are readonly.

        Parameters:
        generation - the generation as of which we want to find the limits
        Returns:
        a possibly empty list of exposure metric limits that were in force at the given generation number.
